sub_title: Learning Historian | Philosopher of History | ReMA-student Philosophy
summary:
I am trained as a philosopher and historian, and am deeply interested in our relations to the past. My work seeks to delve deeper into the complexities of the past, exploring how its affects inform our understanding of the present and the self and our ways of facing the future. I have a specific passion for Italian art and culture, and have written papers on the reception of antiquity by Raphael and his patrons, the exploitation of the undiscovered self by fascism and populism, and relations to the past and the future in the films of Paolo Sorrentino. I believe that by examining the ways in which history, philosophy, and rhetoric intersect, we can gain a fruitful understanding of the human condition and our place within the world.

Whether through my writing, speaking engagements or consultancy services, I am committed to revitalizing the past for a future that is better than the present we are enduring.
